name: 2022 Post ToS - Exhausted
description:
### Goal

To properly structure your post-ToS recovery week, and get you ready for another crack at Full Frontal

### Best for

Those who are feeling exceptionally fatigued, and/or completed the Nuclear option and need some proper rest before another crack at Full Frontal

### Training volume

2 to 4 hours per week

### Plan ends with

Full Frontal

### Special Notes

Recovery is important, don't be afraid to take it nice and easy for the first week after stage 9!
planDescription: For those who had to dig deep every day to finish the tour

prospects.name: Cool Down: 20 Minutes
prospects.description: This extended cool-down gives you an extra 20 minutes of pedaling time. Similar to the other cool-down protocols, this one includes two short efforts in the tempo zone to help speed your recovery by flushing clean, fresh blood through the working muscles and clearing metabolites from the hard session you just completed. Turn up that playlist and let's get pedaling!

prospects.name: The Other French Race
prospects.description:
🎬 Film: Rupert Guinness entered the Haute Route Alps in France looking for a new challenge to test his physical and mental strength. But after 800km of cycling through the Alps from Nice to Megève, the cycling journalist and author realized that the experience had delivered to him and the 400-plus starters something far greater. It had provided them with the adventure of a lifetime; from a sense of what it would be like to ride in the fabled Tour de France that he has reported on more than 30 times, to the creation of friendships with fellow riders forged by their shared suffering and encouragement for one another as they cycled through some of the toughest and most spectacular mountains that cycling has to offer.

​

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

prospects.name: Costa Blanca: Puerto de la Vall de Ebo (Recharger Ride)
prospects.description:
This is an active recovery ride built with purpose. Low-intensity endurance work is paired with brief high-cadence neuromuscular activations to keep the nervous system awake without creating new fatigue. You’ll stay well below threshold throughout, allowing your body to absorb previous hard sessions and prepare for what’s ahead.

​

Set on the peaceful roads leading to the summit of Port de la Vall d’Ebo, this ride promotes circulation, technique, and mental reset. It’s ideal after race days or big training blocks — a smart session that helps you recover better, so you can train harder tomorrow. No ego, no watts chasing — just intentional recovery done right.

​

[**Wahoo Route**](https://www.strava.com/activities/13996505846)

​

_Your Host: There are few people who know the mountains and roads of Europe better than Wahoo Ambassador Michael Cotty. As founder of The Col Collective, Mike has made a career out of riding, filming, and telling the story of epic rides and mountains across the continent. As your On Location co-creator and host, Mike's engaging character, curious mind, and friendly nature will have you cueing up your next ride with him before you've even finished the cool-down._

prospects.name: Serbia Upside Down Ep. 4
prospects.description:
🎬 Film: Serbia. A small country in the Balkan Peninsula that hides some of the most beautiful natural wonders and unique cultural heritage in this part of the world. Yet it remains unknown to many. Only the alternative, curious and brave plan their journeys in this hidden gem. However, a small self-organized crew from Serbia and Germany set a mission to discover and reveal those stunning natural creations of Serbia. On a bicycle. In just five days, they traversed 450 kilometers across six mountains of Western Serbia, and climbed around 11,000 meters to film and produce what you are about to experience.

​

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

prospects.name: French Pyrenees: Cirque du Litor
prospects.description:
The Cirque du Litor is one of the absolute highlights of the French Pyrenees. This ride starts at the top of the Col du Soulour and, after a short downhill, steadily climbs up to the legendary Col d'Aubisque. And, like the climb itself, we'll gradually increase the effort on the way up until we're at our limit by the top. Along the way, you'll try some world-class Pan au Chocolat, keep your eye out for eagles, dive into the local mining history, and relive an epic moment in Tour de France history.

​

[**Route on Strava**](https://www.strava.com/activities/3778593533)

​

_Your Host: There are few people who know the mountains and roads of Europe better than Wahoo Ambassador Michael Cotty. As founder of The Col Collective, Mike has made a career out of riding, filming, and telling the story of epic rides and mountains across the continent. As your On Location co-creator and host, Mike's engaging character, curious mind, and friendly nature will have you cueing up your next ride with him before you've even finished the cool-down._

prospects.name: Cadence Builds
prospects.description:
One of the best sessions for neuromuscular training, this drill asks you to progressively build from a cadence of 90 RPM to your MAX over 30 seconds, recover, and repeat several times. Cadence builds improve how you recruit your leg, gluteal, and core muscles throughout your pedal stroke by progressing to your maximal cadence. By reaching your highest cadence possible, you are training the 'on/off' switch in each muscle group to not only work faster but to have less overlap with your other muscle groups. This session trains your hamstring muscles to 'turn off' when your quads 'turn on' and vice-versa, resulting in a more efficient pedal stroke at both high and low cadences.

​

**LEARN MORE**

Listen to The Knowledge podcast, by Wahoo Sports Science - The Benefits of High Cadence Training: [https://wahoosystm.com/BenefitsofHighCadence](https://wahoosystm.com/BenefitsofHighCadence)

prospects.name: Half Monty (Ramp Test)
prospects.description:
**Half Monty: The Easy One.**

​

We recommend this fitness test for:

- Newer riders
- Athletes with limited experience pacing maximal efforts / fitness testing.
- Those who are mid-plan or who just want to get a sense of where their fitness is.

The _Half Monty_ 4DP fitness test is the most accurate and complete ramp test available. While it's not as comprehensive or as accurate as our main fitness test, _Full Frontal_, it's far more approachable and easier to pace for new riders. It also doesn't require any special preparation. You just need to feel relatively fresh.

​

Based on more than a year of research (and after dozens of lab tests and thousands of online tests) and using sophisticated analysis of power and heart rate data, _Half Monty_ is far more accurate and comprehensive than standard ramp tests.

​

It also tells you more about who you are as an athlete. _Half Monty_ provides you with your FTP, Maximal Aerobic Power (MAP), and Cycling Threshold Heart Rate (cTHR), all of which we use to personalize your workout targets.

​

If you're still using the 4DP estimates when you set up your account, _Half Monty_ will also refine your AC and NM estimates (but will not do so if you've done _Full Frontal_ or manually adjusted your estimates). If you want fully accurate AC and NM, as well as your Rider Type, Strengths, Weaknesses, and training plans adjusted to those Strengths and Weaknesses, you'll need to expose yourself to the _Full Frontal_ 4DP fitness test.

​

Ready to climb the ramp? You'll need the following before you start:

- A heart rate monitor if you want the most accurate results. Don't have one? Order one [HERE](https://wahoofitness.com/devices)
- Some kind of power device connected (trainer, power meter, virtual power, etc.)
- Be ready to pay close attention to the instructions in the workout
- Be sure your profile is complete and up-to-date (Profile > About You). Accurate information helps us make our calculations

**LEARN MORE**

Listen to '[Why Fitness Testing Matters](https://the-knowledge-by-wahoo-sports-science.simplecast.com/episodes/testing-testing-1-2-3-why-fitness-testing-matters)' on The Knowledge Podcast by Wahoo Sports Science.

​

[Here's some more information on how to get the most from your fitness test.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterFitnessAssessment)

prospects.name: Primers
prospects.description: Whether you have a 4DP® fitness test coming up, a group ride you want to smash, that event you have been training all winter for, or even just a fun route you want to have a great ride on, this is the perfect session to do the day before. Unlike other SYSTM sessions, this one should not be viewed as a stand-alone “training” session, but rather, the ace up your sleeve you pull out when that big ride comes around. The key to this session is having you spend just enough time right around threshold, with sufficient recovery between efforts and a handful of sprints to prime all of your systems for tomorrow's event.

prospects.name: Full Frontal (4DP Assessment)
prospects.description:
Full Frontal: The Complete One.

We recommend the Full Frontal 4DP fitness assessment for:

- Experienced riders.
- Athletes with experience pacing maximal efforts / fitness testing.
- Those about to start—or who have just finished—a training plan.

This is our full 4DP fitness test and is the only test that exposes every aspect of your unique physiology in a single hour. Developed by Head of Wahoo Sports Science Coach Neal Henderson, Full Frontal uses the same lab-verified testing protocol that Coach Neal has used at the highest level for over a decade with professional and amateur athletes.

​

This test will provide you with a complete Four-Dimensional Power profile, identify your Rider Type, and tell you exactly what aspects of your fitness you need to focus on to become a more complete cyclist. More importantly, SYSTM will then use your results to set personalized power targets for all of your workouts based on your unique profile, resulting in the most precise, effective workouts available. Your results will also be used to tailor all of your training plans.

​

We recommend re-testing with Full Frontal every 8-12 weeks or as prescribed by your training plan.

​

**LEARN MORE**

Listen to '[Why Fitness Testing Matters](https://the-knowledge-by-wahoo-sports-science.simplecast.com/episodes/testing-testing-1-2-3-why-fitness-testing-matters)' on The Knowledge Podcast by Wahoo Sports Science

​

[Here's some more information on how to get the most from your fitness test.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterFitnessAssessment)

prospects.name: 21. How Did it Go?
prospects.description:
Once the dust has settled and your heart rate has returned to normal levels, listen to this module. It's meant to be completed 15 minutes after the event ends. Part two of this exercise is completed the next day when you’ve had time to process and reflect on everything that happened during the event day.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 06. Relaxing to Recover
prospects.description:
Here you will complete a full Progressive Muscle Relaxation session. It’s part guided meditation and part focus exercise. You should listen to this module at least once per week to get in tune with your body, release tension, and maximize recovery.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 08. Improving Focus
prospects.description:
Develop an understanding of why focused concentration is so important to your performance. We will delve into what it means to be in “The Zone," look at the psychology and the physiology of peak performance, and what it takes to get there.

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: Super Easy Stretch Routine I
prospects.description: Are you looking for a simple stretching routine you can do on a regular basis? New to yoga? Designed for yoga beginners, this gentle yoga session will get you on the road to a more flexible you. You've said for years you'd start stretching. Now's your chance.

prospects.name: End Of Day Stretch
prospects.description:
This slow and stretchy sequence is ideal for practicing at the end of a long day at work or after travel. It focuses on opening up the chest and shoulders, stretching the neck and forearms, and releasing tension in the calves, hamstrings, hips, and lower back. These poses can also be used after a workout for a comprehensive full-body stretch.

​

The objectives are to stretch the neck, shoulders, triceps, chest, and forearms; release tension in the lower back, hips, hamstrings, calves, ankles, and feet; transition the body into parasympathetic "rest or digest" mode after exercise; and help alleviate lower and mid back pain.

​

**Poses in this session:**

- Puppy
- Screaming Toe
- Neck Stretch
- Ankle Stretch
- Chest Stretch
- Forearm Stretch
- Downward Dog
- Revolved Standing Forward Bend
- Low Lunge Chest Opener
- Dead Pigeon
- Reclining Spinal Twist

prospects.name: Morning Yoga Routine
prospects.description: In this sequence, we start with a short breathing exercise to relax the body and calm the mind, then mobilize joints throughout the body. From there we move into deeper stretches for the hips and hamstrings and finish with a short meditation.

prospects.name: Pre-Ride Warm-Up
prospects.description:
This sequence is designed to activate your posterior chain—the calves, hamstrings, glutes, lower, upper, and mid-back, as well as your core—the abs and obliques. It’s crucial that you engage these muscles before every ride to give you maximum power, speed, and endurance on the bike.

​

Listen to why warm-ups are so important in this episode of The Knowledge podcast by Wahoo Sports Science:

[https://wahoosystm.com/WarmingupTheEngine](https://wahoosystm.com/WarmingupTheEngine)

prospects.name: Recovery Booster
prospects.description: It may seem counterintuitive, but it's during recovery when you actually get stronger and consolidate the gains you've made while training. Without proper recovery, you won't improve. This session helps boost your recovery time, relaxing you and ensuring you give your body the chance to grow stronger.

prospects.name: Post-Workout Cool-Down
prospects.description: This gentle cool-down is designed to completely unwind you after your ride…and potentially send you to sleep. We move systematically through the body, loosening up and stretching out tight muscles. Try to stay relaxed throughout while breathing in and out through your nose.

prospects.name: Recovery Session A
prospects.description:
These recovery sessions are easy enough that you get the rest you need, but work you hard enough that your body continues to adapt to the new demands you place on it. You might see these sessions as too short and too easy to be beneficial, but just like a proper recovery spin, active recovery is infinitely better than doing nothing at all. Given how short this session is, we strongly recommend also doing a Yoga Session in the app first. Something like Mobilize and Activate, Balance and Agility, or Full Body Mobilization.

​

**Exercises Included**

- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hands Up
- Kneeling Hip Drive with Hands to Side
- High Plank
- Plank
- Hip Bridge
- Bent Leg Tip at the Hip
- Standing Hip Drive with Hands Up
- Standing Hip Drive with Hands to Side

prospects.name: Full Body 01
prospects.description:
_Want a strength training routine that covers all the bases? Our Full Body Strength series is exactly what you’re after, offering a well-rounded series of exercises that covers the lower body, core, posterior chain, and upper body. With a substantial progression, there’s enough here to keep you busy -- and improving -- for a very long time._

​

This is the first routine in the Full Body series. It introduces the most basic versions of moves that make up the majority of this program. Some of these moves may seem very basic but we encourage you to focus on perfect form and execution during these early levels so that when we turn up the heat you have things nailed. As you'll see, all the exercises at the lower levels will progress in a similar fashion going forward. We're building strength, but also fine-tuning your nervous system. As the program progresses you'll be asked to complete more difficult variations on each foundational move.

​

As with all the strength training routines, it helps if you’ve done a warm-up before getting started. That can be one of your favorite yoga routines, riding your bike on the trainer for 5-10 minutes, or doing a personal stretching routine.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Kneeling Hip Drive - Hands Over Head
- Kneeling Hip Drive - Hands Side to Side
- Hip Bridge with Reps
- Bent Leg Tip at the Hip
- Goblet Squat
- Single-Leg Squat
- Backward Lunge
- Hip Hinge with Reach
- Hip Bridge with Reps
- Push-Up on Knees
- Back Extension
- Quadruped with Leg Lifts
- Plank with Leg Lifts

prospects.name: Dynamic Focus 01
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve your mobility, stability, power, and coordination? The Dynamic Focus series is a fun, unique, and valuable mix of balance, strength, and jumping exercises that develops your overall coordination and control._

​

As the first session in this progression, we introduce you to an integrated sequence of athletic movements. This mix may feel different and challenging..maybe even fun! Embrace it!

​

Please take your time, especially in this initial session. Start and stop the video to rewatch the demonstrations, if necessary, to ensure you understand the movement and grasp the range of motion. Finally, for the exercises that include a balance component, it will be ideal to keep your gaze fixed on a still object, not your screen.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Split Stance Backbend w/ Arms overhead
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Around the clock Heel & Toe Taps
- Alternating-Step Under
- Split Stance Hip Hinges
- Low Skip In Place
- Single leg Hip Hinge
- Tip Toe Walk
- Deep Squat w/Arms Crossed
- Drop to Squat & Hold - Dbl. Leg
- Hop to Opposite Leg w/Hold
- Toe Touch

prospects.name: Core Focus 01
prospects.description:
_Looking to improve ALL of the muscles that make up your core? You’ve come to the right place. The Core Focus series builds up everything from your hip to your shoulders - front, back, and side._

​

To do this, we’ll take you through a variety of contraction types: eccentric (lengthening), concentric (shortening), and isometric (holding a position). The result? Improved core strength, stability, and endurance. You'll find exercises that carry over into other areas of your body, but all of the moves have a significant impact on your core. Level 1 is ideal for very beginners. Even then, you may find some of these moves challenging if you have never attempted them. That’s ok, take your time and pause the video if you need. Soon you’ll be on your way to mastering your core potential. In addition to a mat, you'll need some open wall space for this routine.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you? [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Split Stance Side Bend w/ Arms Overhead
- Downward Dog
- Quadruped T-Spine Rotation
- Back Extension w/ opp arm & leg raise
- Hamstring Hip Bridge
- Oblique Leg Lifts
- Quadruped w/ alternating arm raise
- Quad w/ leg raises
- Low Side Plank w/ toe-tap front/back
- High Side Plank w/ Hold
- Quad Toes w/ Alternate Arm Raise
- Quadruped Pull In & Hold
- Quadruped Push Out & Hold
- Bird Dogs
- Back Extension with Hold
- Child's Pose

prospects.name: Breathing to Crush Them
prospects.description: This is the breathing technique used by Navy Seals to help them focus and find calm before major operations. Learn and use this technique before heading into your own major events and races.

prospects.description: This is the breathing technique used by Navy Seals to help them focus and find calm before major operations. Learn and use this technique before heading into your own major events and races.
